p95_lead_time.name: P95 Lead Time Scale
p95_lead_time.description: 95th percentile lead time from commit to production
p95_lead_time.purpose: Measure deployment flow efficiency - lower time enables faster learning cycles

anchors.label: < 1 day
anchors.description: Exceptional: Sub-day deployment capability with full automation

anchors.label: 1-7 days
anchors.description: Good: Weekly deployment rhythm with reliable automation

anchors.label: 1-4 weeks
anchors.description: Moderate: Monthly deployment cycle with some automation

anchors.label: 1-6 months
anchors.description: Poor: Quarterly or slower deployments with manual processes

anchors.label: > 6 months
anchors.description: Critical: Very slow deployment capability, largely manual

deploy_frequency.name: Deployment Frequency Scale
deploy_frequency.description: How often code deployments occur to production
deploy_frequency.purpose: Measure delivery velocity and batch size optimization

anchors.label: Multiple per day
anchors.description: Elite: On-demand deployments multiple times daily

anchors.label: Daily
anchors.description: High: Daily deployment capability and practice

anchors.label: Weekly
anchors.description: Medium: Regular weekly deployment schedule

anchors.label: Monthly
anchors.description: Low: Monthly or bi-weekly deployment cycle

anchors.label: Quarterly or less
anchors.description: Poor: Infrequent deployments with large batch sizes

change_failure_rate.name: Change Failure Rate
change_failure_rate.description: Percentage of deployments causing production issues
change_failure_rate.purpose: Measure deployment quality and risk management

anchors.description: Elite: Very low failure rate with excellent quality practices
High: Good quality with occasional issues
Medium: Moderate failure rate requiring improvement
Low: High failure rate indicating quality issues
Poor: Very high failure rate, significant quality problems

mttr_scale.name: Mean Time to Recovery
mttr_scale.description: Average time to recover from production incidents
mttr_scale.purpose: Measure incident response capability and system resilience

anchors.label: < 1 hour
anchors.description: Elite: Sub-hour recovery with automated detection and response

anchors.label: 1-24 hours
anchors.description: High: Same-day recovery with good monitoring and processes

anchors.label: 1-7 days
anchors.description: Medium: Recovery within a week with established procedures

anchors.label: 1-4 weeks
anchors.description: Low: Extended recovery time indicating process gaps

anchors.label: > 1 month
anchors.description: Poor: Very slow recovery indicating significant capability gaps

slo_coverage_pct.name: SLO Coverage Percentage
slo_coverage_pct.description: Percentage of critical services with defined SLOs
slo_coverage_pct.purpose: Measure reliability engineering maturity and service coverage

anchors.description: Excellent: Comprehensive SLO coverage across all critical services
Good: Most critical services have defined SLOs
Moderate: Some services have SLOs, gaps remain
Limited: Few services have defined SLOs
Poor: Minimal or no SLO coverage

eng_cust_hours.name: Engineer-Customer Interaction Hours
eng_cust_hours.description: Weekly hours engineers spend directly with customers
eng_cust_hours.purpose: Measure customer proximity and feedback loop effectiveness

anchors.label: > 4 hours/week
anchors.description: Excellent: Regular, substantial customer interaction

anchors.label: 2-4 hours/week
anchors.description: Good: Regular customer interaction sessions

anchors.label: 1-2 hours/week
anchors.description: Moderate: Some direct customer exposure

anchors.label: < 1 hour/week
anchors.description: Limited: Minimal direct customer interaction

anchors.label: None
anchors.description: Poor: No direct customer interaction

ci_feedback_time.name: CI Feedback Time
ci_feedback_time.description: Median time for CI pipeline to provide test results
ci_feedback_time.purpose: Measure development feedback loop speed for quality and productivity

anchors.label: < 10 minutes
anchors.description: Excellent: Very fast feedback enabling tight development loops

anchors.label: 10-30 minutes
anchors.description: Good: Fast enough for effective development flow

anchors.label: 30-60 minutes
anchors.description: Moderate: Acceptable feedback time with some delays

anchors.label: 1-4 hours
anchors.description: Slow: Feedback delays impact development productivity

anchors.label: > 4 hours
anchors.description: Poor: Very slow feedback significantly impacts flow

generic_0_100.name: Generic Percentage Scale
generic_0_100.description: General purpose 0-100% scale for coverage metrics
generic_0_100.purpose: Measure coverage, adoption, or completion percentages

anchors.description: Excellent: Near-complete or complete coverage
Good: High coverage with minor gaps
Moderate: Partial coverage, improvement needed
Limited: Low coverage, significant gaps
Poor: Minimal or no coverage
